      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            # Provides a modified +Hash+ that you can include in your object
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            # for handling error messages and interacting with Action View helpers.
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
            #
        
      12.

      13.

            #
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            #   class Person
        
      15.

      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
            # The last three methods are required in your object for Errors to be
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
            # able to generate error messages correctly and also handle multiple
        
      46. 
      
        
    46.

      47.

      48. 
      
        
    48.

    49.

            #

              def include?(attribute)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                messages[attribute].present?

              end

              def [](attribute)
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          70
          
                get(attribute.to_sym) || set(attribute.to_sym, [])

              # Adds to the supplied attribute the supplied error message.

      144.

          1
          
              def []=(attribute, error)
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                self[attribute] << error
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
              end
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
          
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
              # Iterates through each error key, value pair in the error messages hash.
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
              # Yields the attribute and the error for that attribute. If the attribute
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
              # has more than one error message, yields once for each error message.
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
              #
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "can't be blank")
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.each do |attribute, error|
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
              #     # Will yield :name and "can't be blank"
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
              #
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "must be specified")
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.each do |attribute, error|
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
              #     # Will yield :name and "can't be blank"
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
              #     # then yield :name and "must be specified"
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          1
          
              def each
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          26
          
                messages.each_key do |attribute|
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          72
          
                  self[attribute].each { |error| yield attribute, error }
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                end
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
              end
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
          
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
              # Returns the number of error messages.
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
              #
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "can't be blank")
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.size # => 1
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "must be specified")
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.size # => 2
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          1
          
              def size
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                values.flatten.size
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
              end
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
          
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
              # Returns all message values.
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
              #
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages # => {:name=>["cannot be nil", "must be specified"]}
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.values   # => [["cannot be nil", "must be specified"]]
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          1
          
              def values
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                messages.values
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
              end
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
          
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
              # Returns all message keys.
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
              #
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages # => {:name=>["cannot be nil", "must be specified"]}
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.keys     # => [:name]
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          1
          
              def keys
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                messages.keys
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
              end
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
          
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
              # Returns an array of error messages, with the attribute name included.
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
              #
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "can't be blank")
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "must be specified")
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.to_a # => ["name can't be blank", "name must be specified"]
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          1
          
              def to_a
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
                full_messages
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
              end
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
          
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
              # Returns the number of error messages.
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
              #
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "can't be blank")
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.count # => 1
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "must be specified")
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.count # => 2
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          1
          
              def count
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                to_a.size
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
              end
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
          
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
              # Returns +true+ if no errors are found, +false+ otherwise.
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
              # If the error message is a string it can be empty.
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
              #
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.full_messages # => ["name cannot be nil"]
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.empty?        # => false
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          1
          
              def empty?
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          40
          
                all? { |k, v| v && v.empty? && !v.is_a?(String) }
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
              end
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
              # aliases empty?
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          1
          
              alias_method :blank?, :empty?
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
          
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
              # Returns an xml formatted representation of the Errors hash.
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
              #
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "can't be blank")
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "must be specified")
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.to_xml
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
              #   # =>
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
              #   #  <?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
              #   #  <errors>
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
              #   #    <error>name can't be blank</error>
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
              #   #    <error>name must be specified</error>
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
              #   #  </errors>
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          1
          
              def to_xml(options={})
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                to_a.to_xml({ root: "errors", skip_types: true }.merge!(options))
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
              end
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
          
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
              # Returns a Hash that can be used as the JSON representation for this
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
              # object. You can pass the <tt>:full_messages</tt> option. This determines
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
              # if the json object should contain full messages or not (false by default).
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
              #
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.as_json                      # => {:name=>["cannot be nil"]}
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.as_json(full_messages: true) # => {:name=>["name cannot be nil"]}
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          1
          
              def as_json(options=nil)
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                to_hash(options && options[:full_messages])
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
              end
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
          
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
              # Returns a Hash of attributes with their error messages. If +full_messages+
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
              # is +true+, it will contain full messages (see +full_message+).
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
              #
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.to_hash       # => {:name=>["cannot be nil"]}
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.to_hash(true) # => {:name=>["name cannot be nil"]}
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          1
          
              def to_hash(full_messages = false)
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                if full_messages
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                  self.messages.each_with_object({}) do |(attribute, array), messages|
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                    messages[attribute] = array.map { |message| full_message(attribute, message) }
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                  end
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                else
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                  self.messages.dup
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                end
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
              end
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
          
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
              # Adds +message+ to the error messages on +attribute+. More than one error
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
              # can be added to the same +attribute+. If no +message+ is supplied,
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
              # <tt>:invalid</tt> is assumed.
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
              #
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name)
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
              #   # => ["is invalid"]
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, 'must be implemented')
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
              #   # => ["is invalid", "must be implemented"]
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
              #
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
              #   # => {:name=>["must be implemented", "is invalid"]}
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
              #
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
              # If +message+ is a symbol, it will be translated using the appropriate
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
              # scope (see +generate_message+).
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
              #
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
              # If +message+ is a proc, it will be called, allowing for things like
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
              # <tt>Time.now</tt> to be used within an error.
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
              #
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
              # If the <tt>:strict</tt> option is set to +true+, it will raise
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
              # ActiveModel::StrictValidationFailed instead of adding the error.
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
              # <tt>:strict</tt> option can also be set to any other exception.
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
              #
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, nil, strict: true)
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
              #   # => ActiveModel::StrictValidationFailed: name is invalid
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, nil, strict: NameIsInvalid)
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
              #   # => NameIsInvalid: name is invalid
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
              #
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages # => {}
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
              #
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
              # +attribute+ should be set to <tt>:base</tt> if the error is not
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
              # directly associated with a single attribute.
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
              #
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:base, "either name or email must be present")
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
              #   # => {:base=>["either name or email must be present"]}
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          1
          
              def add(attribute, message = :invalid, options = {})
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          28
          
                message = normalize_message(attribute, message, options)
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          28
          
                if exception = options[:strict]
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
                  exception = ActiveModel::StrictValidationFailed if exception == true
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
                  raise exception, full_message(attribute, message)
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
                end
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
          
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          28
          
                self[attribute] << message
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
              end
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
          
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
              # Will add an error message to each of the attributes in +attributes+
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
              # that is empty.
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
              #
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add_on_empty(:name)
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
              #   # => {:name=>["can't be empty"]}
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          1
          
              def add_on_empty(attributes, options = {})
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
                Array(attributes).each do |attribute|
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
                  value = @base.send(:read_attribute_for_validation, attribute)
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
                  is_empty = value.respond_to?(:empty?) ? value.empty? : false
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
                  add(attribute, :empty, options) if value.nil? || is_empty
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                end
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
              end
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
          
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
              # Will add an error message to each of the attributes in +attributes+ that
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
              # is blank (using Object#blank?).
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
              #
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add_on_blank(:name)
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
              #   # => {:name=>["can't be blank"]}
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          1
          
              def add_on_blank(attributes, options = {})
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
                Array(attributes).each do |attribute|
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
                  value = @base.send(:read_attribute_for_validation, attribute)
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
                  add(attribute, :blank, options) if value.blank?
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
                end
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
              end
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
          
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
              # Returns +true+ if an error on the attribute with the given message is
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
              # present, +false+ otherwise. +message+ is treated the same as for +add+.
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
              #
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add :name, :blank
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.added? :name, :blank # => true
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          1
          
              def added?(attribute, message = :invalid, options = {})
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
                message = normalize_message(attribute, message, options)
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                self[attribute].include? message
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
              end
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
          
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
              # Returns all the full error messages in an array.
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
              #
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
              #   class Person
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
              #     validates_presence_of :name, :address, :email
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
              #     validates_length_of :name, in: 5..30
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
              #
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
              #   person = Person.create(address: '123 First St.')
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.full_messages
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
              #   # => ["Name is too short (minimum is 5 characters)", "Name can't be blank", "Email can't be blank"]
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          1
          
              def full_messages
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
                map { |attribute, message| full_message(attribute, message) }
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
              end
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
          
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
              # Returns all the full error messages for a given attribute in an array.
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
              #
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
              #   class Person
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
              #     validates_presence_of :name, :email
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
              #     validates_length_of :name, in: 5..30
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
              #
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
              #   person = Person.create()
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.full_messages_for(:name)
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
              #   # => ["Name is too short (minimum is 5 characters)", "Name can't be blank"]
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          1
          
              def full_messages_for(attribute)
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
                (get(attribute) || []).map { |message| full_message(attribute, message) }
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
              end
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
          
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
              # Returns a full message for a given attribute.
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
              #
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.full_message(:name, 'is invalid') # => "Name is invalid"
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          1
          
              def full_message(attribute, message)
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
                return message if attribute == :base
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
                attr_name = attribute.to_s.tr('.', '_').humanize
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
                attr_name = @base.class.human_attribute_name(attribute, default: attr_name)
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
                I18n.t(:"errors.format", {
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
                  default:  "%{attribute} %{message}",
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
                  attribute: attr_name,
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
                  message:   message
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
                })
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
              end
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
          
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
              # Translates an error message in its default scope
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
              # (<tt>activemodel.errors.messages</tt>).
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
              #
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
              # Error messages are first looked up in <tt>models.MODEL.attributes.ATTRIBUTE.MESSAGE</tt>,
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
              # if it's not there, it's looked up in <tt>models.MODEL.MESSAGE</tt> and if
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
              # that is not there also, it returns the translation of the default message
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
              # (e.g. <tt>activemodel.errors.messages.MESSAGE</tt>). The translated model
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
              # name, translated attribute name and the value are available for
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
              # interpolation.
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
              #
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
              # When using inheritance in your models, it will check all the inherited
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
              # models too, but only if the model itself hasn't been found. Say you have
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
              # <tt>class Admin < User; end</tt> and you wanted the translation for
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
              # the <tt>:blank</tt> error message for the <tt>title</tt> attribute,
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
              # it looks for these translations:
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
              #
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
              # * <tt>activemodel.errors.models.admin.attributes.title.blank</tt>
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
              # * <tt>activemodel.errors.models.admin.blank</tt>
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
              # * <tt>activemodel.errors.models.user.attributes.title.blank</tt>
        
      407. 
      
        
    407.

                def self.initial_count_for(connection, name, table_joins)
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
                  # quoted_name should be downcased as some database adapters (Oracle) return quoted name in uppercase
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                  quoted_name = connection.quote_table_name(name).downcase
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                  counts = table_joins.map do |join|
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                    if join.is_a?(Arel::Nodes::StringJoin)
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                      # Table names + table aliases
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                      join.left.downcase.scan(
        
      33.

                        /join(?:\s+\w+)?\s+(\S+\s+)?#{quoted_name}\son/
        
      34.

                      ).size
        
      35. 
      
        
    35.

      36.

      38.

                def aliased_table_for(table_name, aliased_name)
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          20
          
                  if aliases[table_name].zero?
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                    # If it's zero, we can have our table_name
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          20
          
                    aliases[table_name] = 1
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          20
          
                    Arel::Table.new(table_name)
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                  else
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                    # Otherwise, we need to use an alias
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                    aliased_name = connection.table_alias_for(aliased_name)
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
          
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                    # Update the count
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                    aliases[aliased_name] += 1
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
          
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                    table_alias = if aliases[aliased_name] > 1
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                      "#{truncate(aliased_name)}_#{aliases[aliased_name]}"
        
      73. 
      
        
    73.

      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                      aliased_name
        
      75. 
      
        
    75.

      76.

      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                  end
        
      78.

                end

              def wrap_scope(scope, mod)

                  def initialize(tables)

                    @tables = tables

                      h[table.node] = table.columns.each_with_object({}) { |column,i|

                        i[column.name] = column.alias

                def self.make_tree(associations)
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          20
          
                  hash = {}
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          20
          
                  walk_tree associations, hash
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          20
          
                  hash
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                end
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
          
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          1
          
                def self.walk_tree(associations, hash)
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          20
          
                  case associations
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                  when Symbol, String
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                    hash[associations.to_sym] ||= {}
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                  when Array
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          20
          
                    associations.each do |assoc|
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                      walk_tree assoc, hash
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                    end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                  when Hash
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                    associations.each do |k,v|
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                      cache = hash[k] ||= {}
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                      walk_tree v, cache
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                    end
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                  else
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                    raise ConfigurationError, associations.inspect
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                  end
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                # base is the base class on which operation is taking place.
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                # associations is the list of associations which are joined using hash, symbol or array.
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                # joins is the list of all string join commands and arel nodes.
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                #
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                #  Example :
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                #
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                #  class Physician < ActiveRecord::Base
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                #    has_many :appointments
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                #    has_many :patients, through: :appointments
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                #  end
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                #
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                #  If I execute `@physician.patients.to_a` then
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                #    base # => Physician
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                #    associations # => []
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                #    joins # =>  [#<Arel::Nodes::InnerJoin: ...]
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                #
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                #  However if I execute `Physician.joins(:appointments).to_a` then
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                #    base # => Physician
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                #    associations # => [:appointments]
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                #    joins # =>  []
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                #
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          1
          
                def initialize(base, associations, joins)
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          20
          
                  @alias_tracker = AliasTracker.create(base.connection, joins)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          20
          
                  @alias_tracker.aliased_table_for(base.table_name, base.table_name) # Updates the count for base.table_name to 1
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          20
          
                  tree = self.class.make_tree associations
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          20
          
                  @join_root = JoinBase.new base, build(tree, base)
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          20
          
                  @join_root.children.each { |child| construct_tables! @join_root, child }
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                end
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          1
          
                def reflections
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          10
          
                  join_root.drop(1).map!(&:reflection)
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                end
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
          
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          1
          
                def join_constraints(outer_joins)
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          10
          
                  joins = join_root.children.flat_map { |child|
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                    make_inner_joins join_root, child
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                  }
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
          
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          10
          
                  joins.concat outer_joins.flat_map { |oj|
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          10
          
                    if join_root.match? oj.join_root
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          10
          
                      walk join_root, oj.join_root
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                    else
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                      oj.join_root.children.flat_map { |child|
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                        make_outer_joins oj.join_root, child
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                      }
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                    end
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                  }
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                end
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          1
          
                def aliases
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                  Aliases.new join_root.each_with_index.map { |join_part,i|
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                    columns = join_part.column_names.each_with_index.map { |column_name,j|
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                      Aliases::Column.new column_name, "t#{i}_r#{j}"
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                    }
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                    Aliases::Table.new(join_part, columns)
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                  }
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                end
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
          
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          1
          
                def instantiate(result_set, aliases)
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                  primary_key = aliases.column_alias(join_root, join_root.primary_key)
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
          
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                  seen = Hash.new { |h,parent_klass|
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                    h[parent_klass] = Hash.new { |i,parent_id|
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                      i[parent_id] = Hash.new { |j,child_klass| j[child_klass] = {} }
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                    }
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                  }
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
          
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                  model_cache = Hash.new { |h,klass| h[klass] = {} }
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                  parents = model_cache[join_root]
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                  column_aliases = aliases.column_aliases join_root
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
          
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                  message_bus = ActiveSupport::Notifications.instrumenter
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
          
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                  payload = {
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                    record_count: result_set.length,
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                    class_name: join_root.base_klass.name
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                  }
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
          
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                  message_bus.instrument('instantiation.active_record', payload) do
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                    result_set.each { |row_hash|
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                      parent = parents[row_hash[primary_key]] ||= join_root.instantiate(row_hash, column_aliases)
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                      construct(parent, join_root, row_hash, result_set, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                    }
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                  end
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
          
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                  parents.values
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                end
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
          
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          1
          
                private
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
          
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          1
          
                def make_constraints(parent, child, tables, join_type)
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                  chain         = child.reflection.chain
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                  foreign_table = parent.table
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                  foreign_klass = parent.base_klass
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                  child.join_constraints(foreign_table, foreign_klass, child, join_type, tables, child.reflection.scope_chain, chain)
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                end
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
          
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          1
          
                def make_outer_joins(parent, child)
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                  tables    = table_aliases_for(parent, child)
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                  join_type = Arel::Nodes::OuterJoin
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                  info      = make_constraints parent, child, tables, join_type
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
          
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                  [info] + child.children.flat_map { |c| make_outer_joins(child, c) }
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                end
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
          
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          1
          
                def make_inner_joins(parent, child)
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                  tables    = child.tables
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                  join_type = Arel::Nodes::InnerJoin
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                  info      = make_constraints parent, child, tables, join_type
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
          
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                  [info] + child.children.flat_map { |c| make_inner_joins(child, c) }
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                end
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
          
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          1
          
                def table_aliases_for(parent, node)
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                  node.reflection.chain.map { |reflection|
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                    alias_tracker.aliased_table_for(
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                      reflection.table_name,
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                      table_alias_for(reflection, parent, reflection != node.reflection)
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
                    )
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
                  }
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
                end
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
          
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          1
          
                def construct_tables!(parent, node)
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                  node.tables = table_aliases_for(parent, node)
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                  node.children.each { |child| construct_tables! node, child }
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                end
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
          
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          1
          
                def table_alias_for(reflection, parent, join)
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
                  name = "#{reflection.plural_name}_#{parent.table_name}"
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                  name << "_join" if join
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                  name
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                end
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
          
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          1
          
                def walk(left, right)
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          10
          
                  intersection, missing = right.children.map { |node1|
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
                    [left.children.find { |node2| node1.match? node2 }, node1]
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                  }.partition(&:first)
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
          
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          10
          
                  ojs = missing.flat_map { |_,n| make_outer_joins left, n }
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          10
          
                  intersection.flat_map { |l,r| walk l, r }.concat ojs
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                end
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
          
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          1
          
                def find_reflection(klass, name)
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
                  klass._reflect_on_association(name) or
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                    raise ConfigurationError, "Association named '#{ name }' was not found on #{ klass.name }; perhaps you misspelled it?"
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                end
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
          
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          1
          
                def build(associations, base_klass)
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          20
          
                  associations.map do |name, right|
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                    reflection = find_reflection base_klass, name
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
                    reflection.check_validity!
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                    reflection.check_eager_loadable!
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
          
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
                    if reflection.polymorphic?
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                      raise EagerLoadPolymorphicError.new(reflection)
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                    end
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
          
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
                    JoinAssociation.new reflection, build(right, reflection.klass)
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
                  end
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                end
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
          
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          1
          
                def construct(ar_parent, parent, row, rs, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                  primary_id  = ar_parent.id
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
          
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                  parent.children.each do |node|
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
                    if node.reflection.collection?
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
                      other = ar_parent.association(node.reflection.name)
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
                      other.loaded!
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
                    else
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
                      if ar_parent.association_cache.key?(node.reflection.name)
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                        model = ar_parent.association(node.reflection.name).target
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                        construct(model, node, row, rs, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                        next
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                      end
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                    end
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
          
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
                    key = aliases.column_alias(node, node.primary_key)
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
                    id = row[key]
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                    next if id.nil?
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
          
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
                    model = seen[parent.base_klass][primary_id][node.base_klass][id]
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
          
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                    if model
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                      construct(model, node, row, rs, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                    else
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                      model = construct_model(ar_parent, node, row, model_cache, id, aliases)
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                      seen[parent.base_klass][primary_id][node.base_klass][id] = model
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                      construct(model, node, row, rs, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
                    end
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                  end
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                end
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
          
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          1
          
                def construct_model(record, node, row, model_cache, id, aliases)
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                  model = model_cache[node][id] ||= node.instantiate(row,
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                                                                     aliases.column_aliases(node))
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                  other = record.association(node.reflection.name)
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
          
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
                  if node.reflection.collection?
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
                    other.target.push(model)
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
                  else
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                    other.target = model
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                  end
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
          
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
                  other.set_inverse_instance(model)
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
                  model
        
      279.

      280.

          1
          
              class JoinDependency # :nodoc:
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
                # A JoinPart represents a part of a JoinDependency. It is inherited
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
                # by JoinBase and JoinAssociation. A JoinBase represents the Active Record which
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
                # everything else is being joined onto. A JoinAssociation represents an association which
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
                # is joining to the base. A JoinAssociation may result in more than one actual join
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
                # operations (for example a has_and_belongs_to_many JoinAssociation would result in
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
                # two; one for the join table and one for the target table).
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          1
          
                class JoinPart # :nodoc:
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          1
          
                  include Enumerable
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
                  # The Active Record class which this join part is associated 'about'; for a JoinBase
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
                  # this is the actual base model, for a JoinAssociation this is the target model of the
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
                  # association.
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          1

                  def extract_record(row, column_names_with_alias)
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                    # This code is performance critical as it is called per row.
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                    # see: https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/12185
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                    hash = {}
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
          
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                    index = 0
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                    length = column_names_with_alias.length
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
          
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                    while index < length
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                      column_name, alias_name = column_names_with_alias[index]
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                      hash[column_name] = row[alias_name]
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                      index += 1
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                    end
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
          
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                    hash
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                  end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          1
          
                  def instantiate(row, aliases)

    67. 
          
          
                  end

              def calculate(operation, _column_name, _options = {})

      67.

      69. 
      
        
    69.

    vendor/ruby/2.1.0/gems/guard-rspec-4.6.0/lib/guard/rspec_formatter.rb

    1. 
          
          
          # NOTE: This class only exists for RSpec and should not be used by
        
      2. 
      
        
    2.

      3.

              # rspec issue https://github.com/rspec/rspec-core/issues/793

              def self.extract_spec_location(metadata)
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                root_metadata = metadata
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                location = metadata[:location]
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
          
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                until spec_path?(location)
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                  metadata = metadata[:parent_example_group] || metadata[:example_group]
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
          
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                  unless metadata
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                    STDERR.puts "no spec file location in #{root_metadata.inspect}"
        
      38.

      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                  end
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
          
        
      41. 
      
        
    41.

      44.

      45.

      47.

              def self.spec_path?(path)
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                path ||= ""
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                flags = File::FNM_PATHNAME | File::FNM_DOTMATCH
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                if File.const_defined?(:FNM_EXTGLOB) # ruby >= 2
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                  flags |= File::FNM_EXTGLOB
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                end
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                pattern = ::RSpec.configuration.pattern
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                path = path.sub(/:\d+\z/, "")
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                path = Pathname.new(path).cleanpath.to_s
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                File.fnmatch(pattern, path, flags)
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
              end
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
          
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          1
          
              def dump_summary(*args)
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          1

    62. 
          
          
          
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          1

              private

      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
              # Write summary to temporary file for runner
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          1
          
              def write_summary(duration, total, failures, pending)
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          1
          
                _write do |f|
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          1
          
                  f.puts _message(total, failures, pending, duration)
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          1
          
                  f.puts _failed_paths.join("\n") if failures > 0
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                end
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
              end
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
          
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          1
          
              def _write(&block)
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          1
          
                file = _results_file
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          1
          
                FileUtils.mkdir_p(File.dirname(file))
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          1
          
                File.open(file, "w", &block)
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
              end
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
          
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          1
          
              def _failed_paths
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                klass = self.class
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                failed = examples.select { |example| _status_failed?(example) }
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                failed.map { |e| klass.extract_spec_location(e.metadata) }.sort.uniq
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
              end
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
          
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          1
          
              def _message(example_count, failure_count, pending_count, duration)
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          1
          
                message = "#{example_count} examples, #{failure_count} failures"
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          1
          
                if pending_count > 0
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                  message << " (#{pending_count} pending)"
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                end
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          1
          
                message << " in #{duration.round(4)} seconds"
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          1
          
                message
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
              end
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          1
          
              def _status_failed?(example)
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                if self.class.rspec_3?
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                  example.execution_result.status.to_s == "failed"
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                else
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                  example.execution_result[:status].to_s == "failed"
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                end
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
              end
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
          
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          1
          
              def _results_file
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          1
          
                path = ENV["GUARD_RSPEC_RESULTS_FILE"]
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          1
          
                fail "Fatal: No output file given for Guard::RSpec formatter!" unless path
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          1
          
                File.expand_path(path)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
              end
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
            end
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
          end

      58.

                  # @api public
        
      60.

                  #
        
      61.

                  # Invoked at the very end, `close` allows the formatter to clean
        
      62.

                  # up resources, e.g. open streams, etc.
        
      63.

                  def close(_notification)

          1

          1

      71.

    73.

                # ConsoleCodes provides helpers for formatting console output

                # with ANSI codes, e.g. color's and bold.
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          1
          
                module ConsoleCodes
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          1
          
                  VT100_CODES =
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
                    {
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
                      :black   => 30,
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
                      :red     => 31,
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
                      :green   => 32,
        
      13.

                      :blue    => 34,

                      :white   => 37,
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                      :bold    => 1,
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                    }
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      21.

          1
          
                  VT100_CODE_VALUES = VT100_CODES.invert

          1
          
                  module_function

      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          1
          
                  CONFIG_COLORS_TO_METHODS = Configuration.instance_methods.grep(/_color\z/).inject({}) do |hash, method|
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          6
          
                    hash[method.to_s.sub(/_color\z/, '').to_sym] = method
        
      28.

          6

      29.

      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                  # Fetches the correct code for the supplied symbol, or checks
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                  # that a code is valid. Defaults to white (37).
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                  #
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                  # @param code_or_symbol [Symbol, Fixnum] Symbol or code to check
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                  # @return [Fixnum] a console code
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          1
          
                  def console_code_for(code_or_symbol)
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          13
          
                    if (config_method = CONFIG_COLORS_TO_METHODS[code_or_symbol])
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          6
          
                      console_code_for RSpec.configuration.__send__(config_method)
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          7
          
                    elsif VT100_CODE_VALUES.key?(code_or_symbol)
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                      code_or_symbol
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                    else
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          7
          
                      VT100_CODES.fetch(code_or_symbol) do
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                        console_code_for(:white)
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                      end
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                    end
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                  end
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
          
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                  # Wraps a piece of text in ANSI codes with the supplied code. Will
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                  # only apply the control code if `RSpec.configuration.color_enabled?`
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                  # returns true.
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                  #
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                  # @param text [String] the text to wrap
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                  # @param code_or_symbol [Symbol, Fixnum] the desired control code
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                  # @return [String] the wrapped text
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          1
          
                  def wrap(text, code_or_symbol)
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          7
          
                    if RSpec.configuration.color_enabled?
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          7
          
                      "\e[#{console_code_for(code_or_symbol)}m#{text}\e[0m"
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                    else
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                      text
        
      60. 
      
        
    60.

      61.

          # We intentionally do not use the `RSpec::Support.require...` methods

      3.

          require 'rspec/mocks/argument_matchers'

          require 'rspec/support/fuzzy_matcher'
